story_builder.starter: The library book had been checked out for 47 years, and today someone finally returned it.
Every morning at 6:17 AM, the same text message appears on your phone from a number that doesn't exist.
The dragon in your backyard turned out to be surprisingly good at making coffee.
The mannequin in the store window keeps changing positions when no one is looking.
You accidentally grabbed the wrong suitcase at the airport, and inside you found love letters addressed to you.
The treasure map your grandmother left you led to the local grocery store's freezer section.
Your pet goldfish just filed a formal complaint with the neighborhood association.
The parking meter outside your apartment has been counting down instead of up for three days.
The antique mirror you bought shows reflections of rooms that don't exist in your house.
Time travel was invented yesterday, but somehow you remember it being invented last week.
Every Tuesday, someone leaves a single red rose on your doorstep with a different mathematical equation.
The new coffee shop in town only serves customers who can solve their daily riddle.
Your shadow started moving independently last Thursday, and it's been making better life choices than you.
The person you've been video chatting with for months just revealed they're actually from the year 1892.
The GPS in your car has started giving directions to places that don't exist yet.
Your houseplants have formed a union and are demanding better working conditions.
The elevator in your building has been going to a 13th floor that wasn't there yesterday.
The fortune cookie you opened contained a small, very angry fairy instead of a fortune.
Your smart home assistant has been ordering items you need before you realize you need them.
The local museum's dinosaur skeleton has been rearranging itself into different poses each night.
Your childhood imaginary friend just sent you a friend request on social media.
The person who keeps leaving positive notes in your textbooks turned out to be your biggest rival.
The hiking trail you've walked a hundred times suddenly leads to a city you've never seen before.
Your morning alarm clock has been replaced by a small band of medieval minstrels.
The same stranger has been in the background of every photo you've taken for the past month.
The old woman at the farmer's market has been selling the same apples for 200 years.
Your dreams have started appearing as trending topics on social media the next morning.
The lost and found box at work contains items that won't be invented for another decade.
The neighborhood cats have been leaving you increasingly complex origami sculptures.
Your phone's autocorrect has been changing your messages to warn you about things that haven't happened yet.
The person you bumped into at the coffee shop keeps appearing in your dreams from childhood.
The escape room you entered six hours ago doesn't seem to have an exit.
Your refrigerator has started passive-aggressively commenting on your food choices through magnetic poetry.
The security camera footage from your apartment shows you doing things you don't remember doing.
The bookshop owner mentioned that the book you're looking for doesn't exist yet, but offered to introduce you to the author.
Your reflection in mirrors has been showing up three seconds before you actually arrive.
The town's welcome sign keeps changing to welcome different versions of you.
The music box your aunt left you only plays songs that haven't been written yet.
Every book you check out from the library has the same person's notes in the margins.
The subway train you accidentally got on doesn't appear on any map and makes stops in places that don't exist.
